catalog_info.title: Black Holes from A to Z
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: General relativity at level of Physics 210 or equivalent. Physics 253a helpful, but not required.
catalog_info.description: A survey of cosmological and black hole event horizons focusing on the deep puzzles they present concerning the relations between general relativity, quantum mechanics and thermodynamics. Topics include: causal structure, Penrose diagrams, Kerr and deSitter geometries, the thermodynamic laws of horizons, quantum field theory in curved space, Hawking radiation, the information puzzle, the Bekenstein-Hawking entropy/area law, microstate counting, holography, inflation and BICEP2. Prerequisite: General relativity at the level of Physics 210 or equivalent. Physics 253a helpful, but not required.
